Items.Title: Roll Call
Invocation
Items.AgendaNote:
Delivered by:  Father James P. Hayes, St. Andrews R.C. Church, Cardinal Hayes Place, New York, NY  10007.

Motion to spread the invocation in full upon the record by COUNCIL MEMBER FOSTER.
Items.MinutesNote:
The Invocation was delivered by Father James P. Hayes, St. Andrew's R.C. Church, Cardinal Hayes Place, New York, N.Y. 10007.

Council Member Foster moved  that the invocation be spread in full upon the Minutes and adopted.

Items.Title: Adoption of Minutes
Items.AgendaNote: Motion that the Minutes of the Stated Meeting of March 25, 2002 be adopted and printed by Council Member Felder.
Items.MinutesNote: Council Member Felder moved that the Minutes of the Stated Meeting of March 25, 2002 be adopted as printed

By Council Member Vallone:
Pursuant to Rule 11.20(b) of the Council and Section 20-226(g) of the New York City Administrative Code, the Council resolves that the action of the Department of Transportation approving an enclosed sidewalk caf√© located at 41-15 31st Avenue, Queens, shall be subject to review by the Council. (Application no. 20025239TCQ.)

Report of the Committee on Aging

Resolution calling upon the New York State Legislature to adopt Assembly Bill A.4886 and its companion bill, S.2614, which would amend Section 422(1)(a) of the Real Property Tax Law, in relation to providing real property tax exemptions to not-for-profit corporations seeking to construct affordable assisted living facilities for seniors with low to middle incomes.
Items.MatterName: Real Property Tax Law

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the New York State Legislature and the Governor to enact legislation to amend the Real Property Tax Law, in relation to indexing to inflation the maximum income allowed for persons occupying rental units to be eligible for the senior citizen rent increase exemption (SCRIE) program.
Items.MatterName: Tax Abatement, Real Property SCRIE

Items.MatterName: Tax Abatement, Maximum Income (S.1422 A.2254)

Items.MatterName: Commissioner of Deeds

Items.Title:
Introduction and Reading of Bills
See Attached
General Discussion
Extension of Remarks
INTRODUCTION AND READING OF BILLS

State Legislation Resolution requesting the New York State Legislature to pass bills introduced by Senators Maltese, Padavan, Velella, Marchi, Spano, Leibell, Skelos, Balboni, Fuschillo, Hannon, Johnson, Lack, Lavalle, Marcellino, Trunzo and Morahan, S.5852-B, and Assembly Member Abbate, A.10373-A, "AN ACT to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to increasing benefits payable by the police and fire variable supplements funds to pension fund beneficiaries".
Items.MatterName: Increasing benefits payable by the police and fire variable supplements funds to pension fund beneficiaries (S.5852-B, A.10373-A)

Items.Title: State Legislation Resolution requesting the New York State Legislature to pass bills introduced by Senators Maltese, Balboni, Hannon, Johnson, Lavalle, Leibell, Marcellino, Marchi, Morahan, Padavan, Spano, Trunzo and Velella, S.6473-A, and Assembly Member Abbate, A.10407-A, "AN ACT to amend the retirement and social security law and the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to the final average salary of members of the New York city police pension fund and fire department pension fund who are subject to the provisions of article eleven of the retirement and social security law".
Items.MatterName: Final average salary of members of the New York city police pension fund and fire department pension fund (S.6473-A, A.10407-A)

Items.Title: State Legislation Resolution requesting the New York State Legislature to pass bills introduced by Senators Sampson, Hassell-Thompson, Lachman, Markowitz, Montgomery, Santiago, A. Smith and M. Smith, S.1716-A, and Assembly Members Brennan, A. Cohen, Glick, Klein, Dinowitz and Stringer, et al, A.5819-A, "AN ACT to dedicate community gardens as parkland in the state of New York".
Items.MatterName: Dedicate community gardens as parkland in the state of New York (S.1716-A, A.5819-A)

Items.Title: State Legislation Resolution requesting the New York State Legislature to pass a bill introduced by Assembly Member Mirones, A.10320, "AN ACT to amend the civil service law, in relation to special rights for children of firefighters and police officers in cities with a population of one million or more".
Items.MatterName: Special rights for children of firefighters and police officers (A.10320)

Items.Title: State Legislation Resolution requesting the New York State Legislature to pass bills introduced by Senator Velella, S.2745-A, and Assembly Members Abbate, Lavelle, Cymbrowitz and Seddio, et al, A.10195, "AN ACT to amend the retirement and social security law, in relation to the determination of benefits of correction members of the New York city employees' retirement system".
Items.MatterName: Determination of benefits of correction members of the NYCERS (S.2745-A, A.10195)

Items.Title: State Legislation Resolution requesting the New York State Legislature to pass bills introduced by Senator Velella, S.2176-A, and Assembly Members Abbate, Aubry, Seddio, Cymbrowitz and Lavelle, et al, A.10203, "AN ACT to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to allowing correction members of the New York city employees' retirement system to obtain retirement credit for certain periods of child care leave".
Items.MatterName: Allowing correction members of the NYCERS to obtain retirement credit for certain periods of child care leave (S.2176-A, A.10203)

Items.Title: State Legislation Resolution requesting the New York State Legislature to pass bills introduced by Senator Maltese, S.1544-A, and Assembly Member Seminerio, A.2470-A, "AN ACT to amend the retirement and social security law, in relation to employee contributions to the twenty year improved benefit retirement programs for New York city correction members".
Items.MatterName: Employee contributions to the twenty year improved benefit retirement programs for New York city correction members (S.1544-A, A.2470-A)

Items.Title: State Legislation Resolution requesting the New York State Legislature to pass bills introduced by Senator Maltese, S.6151, and Assembly Member Seminerio, A.9705, "AN ACT to amend the retirement and social security law, in relation to eligibility of uniformed personnel of the New York city department of correction for ordinary disability benefits".
Items.MatterName: Eligibility of uniformed personnel of the New York city department of correction for ordinary disability benefits (S.6151, A.9705)

Items.Title: State Legislation Resolution requesting the New York State Legislature to pass bills introduced by Senator Maltese, S.1543-A, and Assembly Member Seminerio, A.2469-A, "AN ACT to amend the retirement and social security law, in relation to disability retirement of certain New York city correction members".
Items.MatterName: Disability retirement of certain New York city correction members (S.1543-A, A.2469-A)

Items.Title: State Legislation Resolution requesting the New York State Legislature to pass bills introduced by Senator Maltese, S.1537-A, and Assembly Member Seminerio, A.2465-A, "AN ACT to amend the retirement and social security law and the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to permitting certain New York city correction members to borrow from their accumulated member contributions and to repeal certain provisions of the retirement and social security law relating thereto".
Items.MatterName: Permitting certain New York city correction members to borrow from their accumulated member contributions (S.1537-A, A.2465-A)

Items.Title: State Legislation Resolution requesting the New York State Legislature to pass bills introduced by Senator Maltese, S.1539-A, and Assembly Member Seminerio, A.2468-A, "AN ACT to amend the retirement and social security law, in relation to the return of member contributions".
Items.MatterName: Return of member contributions (S.1539-A, A.2468-A)

Items.Title: State Legislation Resolution requesting the New York State Legislature to pass bills introduced by Senator Velella, S.6450, and Assembly Member Seminerio, A.10368, "AN ACT to amend the retirement and social security law and the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to loans to correction members of the New York city employees' retirement system".
Items.MatterName: Loans to correction members of the NYCERS (S.6450, A.10368)

Items.Title: State Legislation Resolution requesting the New York State Legislature to pass bills introduced by Senator Maltese, S.2544, and Assembly Member Seminerio, A.4854, "AN ACT to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to continuance of retirement allowance upon election to public office".
Items.MatterName: Continuance of retirement allowance upon election of public office (S.2544, A.4854)

Items.Title: State Legislation Resolution requesting the New York State Legislature to pass bills introduced by Senator Velella, S.6451, and Assembly Member Seminerio, A.10369, "AN ACT to amend the retirement and social security law, in relation to retirement allowances payable to correction members of the New York city employees' retirement system".
Items.MatterName: Retirement allowances payable to correction members of the NYCERS (S.6451, A.10369)

Items.Title: State Legislation Resolution requesting the New York State Legislature to pass a bill introduced by Senator Velella, S.5599-A, "AN ACT to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to loans to members of the New York city fire department pension fund".
Items.MatterName: Loans to members of the New York city fire department pension fund (S.5599-A)

Items.Title: State Legislation Resolution requesting the New York State Legislature to pass bills introduced by Senator Velella, S.6950, and Committee on Rules, A.11031, "AN ACT to amend the administrative code of the city of the New York, in relation to establishing a variable supplements fund for sanitation members of the New York city employees' retirement system".
Items.MatterName: Establishing a variable supplements fund for sanitation members of the NYCERS (S.6950, A.11031)

Items.Title: State Legislation Resolution requesting the New York State Legislature to pass a bill introduced by Assembly Members Clark, Ortiz, Lavelle and Green, et al, A.10718-A, "AN ACT to amend the tax law and the education law, in relation to education tax surcharge".
Items.MatterName: Education tax surcharge (A.10718-A)

Items.Title: State Legislation Resolution requesting the New York State Legislature to pass bills introduced by Senators Padavan, Maltese, Marchi and Velella, S.6313, and Assembly Members Abbate, Colton, Cymbrowitz, Lavelle, Pheffer, Seddio and Weisenberg, et al, A.9915, "AN ACT to amend the retirement and social security law, in relation to the employment of retired New York city police personnel".
Items.MatterName: Employment of retired New York city police personnel (S.6313, A.9915)

Items.Title: State Legislation Resolution requesting the New York State Legislature to pass bills introduced by Senator Leibell, S.7130, and Assembly Members Abbate, M. Cohen, Colton, Cymbrowitz, Markey, Pheffer, Scarborough and Weisenberg, et al, A.9820, "AN ACT to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to allowing members of the police pension fund to obtain retirement credit for certain periods of New York police department cadet corps service".
Items.MatterName: Allowing members of the police pension fund to obtain retirement credit (S.7130, A.9820)

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the Mayor to fully finance and adequately staff the City's Voter Assistance Commission for Fiscal Year 2003.
Items.MatterName: City's Voter Assistance Commission for Fiscal Year 2003

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to the use of ultra low sulfur diesel fuel and the best available technology by nonroad vehicles in city construction.
Items.MatterName: Use of ultra low sulfur diesel fuel by nonroad vehicles.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the United Nations to no longer remain silent and to pass a resolution condemning the practice of suicide bombings by the Palestinian community.
Items.AgendaNote: Cultural Affairs, Libraries & International Intergroup Relations
Items.MatterName: Condemning the practice of suicide bombings by the Palestinian community.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to the notice of defective, unsafe, dangerous or obstructed conditions required as a prerequisite to the maintenance of certain civil actions against the city of New York.
Items.MatterName: Notice of defective, unsafe, dangerous or obstructed conditions required as a prerequisite to the maintenance of certain civil actions.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to the liability of property owners for injuries caused by unsafe conditions on sidewalks.
Items.MatterName: Liability of property owners for injuries caused by unsafe conditions on sidewalks.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to prohibiting the sale and installation of audible motor vehicle alarms.
Items.MatterName: Prohibit the sale/installation of audible motor vehicle alarms.

Items.Title: Resolution, on the 60th anniversary of the fall of Bataan, urging President George W. Bush and the United States Congress to support U.S. House of Representatives bill HR-491 and U.S. Senate bill S-1042.
Items.AgendaNote: Cultural Affairs, Libraries & International Intergroup Relations
Items.MatterName: The 60th anniversary of the fall of Bataan.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to the creation of an advisory board of drivers.
Items.MatterName: Creation of an advisory board of drivers.

Items.Title: Resolution calling on the New York City Police Department and the City of New York to follow an executive order promulgated under the Koch administration that prevents the Police Department from investigating the immigration status of crime victims, persons seeking assistance or volunteering to act as a witness, and thus acting as agents of the Department of Justice's Immigration and Naturalization Service.
Items.MatterName: Investigating the immigration status of crime victims, persons seeking assistance or volunteering to act as a witness,

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the government of the United States to strongly condemn and call for an immediate end to the recent barrage of anti-Jewish violence sweeping across Europe and other Western nations.
Items.AgendaNote: Cultural Affairs, Libraries & International Intergroup Relations
Items.MatterName: Call for an end to the recent barrage of anti-Jewish violence.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the City of New York, in relation to amending the rent stabilization law to provide for the streamlining of the rent regulation system, establishment of rent guidelines for housing accommodations subject to the city rent and rehabilitation law, and to bar certain rent adjustments.
Items.MatterName: Rent Regulations

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the President of the United States, George W. Bush, and the Congress to increase the funding for the Head Start program.
Items.MatterName: Increase the funding for the Head Start program.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the New York State Legislature to adopt A.09943 to amend the education law, in relation to citizenship requirements for permanent teacher certification.
Items.MatterName: Citizenship requirements for permanent teacher certification.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the City of New York, in relation to creating a cause of action against manufacturers of certain weapons.
Items.MatterName: Create cause of action against manufacturers of certain weapons.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon Mayor Michael Bloomberg to file an amicus brief on behalf of the plaintiff in Campaign for Fiscal Equity v. State of New York.
Items.MatterName: Mayor Bloomberg to file an amicus brief on behalf of the plaintiff in Campaign for Fiscal Equity v. NYS

Whereupon on motion of the Speaker (Council Member Miller), the Clerk of the Council adjourned to meet again on Tuesday, May 21, 2002.
VICTOR L. ROBLES, City Clerk
Clerk of the Council
